pullrequest.title: Ensure correct transform for canonical link

content.raw:
I would urge us to represent all ECS kinematic data in the world frame, for a multitude of reasons:

1. It’s almost always the most useful frame of reference for systems \(e.g. physics systems and rendering systems\)
2. It eliminates huge amounts of complexity, pain points, and potential confusion over how we’re representing data
3. It allows one system \(physics\) to be responsible for computing forward kinematics, and then all other systems can benefit from that one-time computation
4. When transforming between reference frames, you almost always convert to the world frame first, so if we have a system that converts between reference frames, then it would want to consume world frame data anyhow

If there’s an ongoing discussion for this topic, I could post these points there instead.
